revised_title: Proteids of the Seeds of Abrus Precatorius (Jequirity)
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the proteids found in the seeds of Abrus precatorius, also known as jequirity. They discovered two main proteids: a vegetable paraglobulin and a-phytalbumose. These proteids have poisonous properties and are important for understanding the plant's physiological actions.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
